title.narrative: Oil palm, livestock and cocoa: An integrated landscape management approach.

description.narrative:
In the South Caribbean Coastal Autonomous Region of Nicaragua, we have convened 49 producers, private companies, civil society organisations, and government agencies in the Paisajes Sostenibles (PaSos) platform to work towards sustainable landscape management, so as to enhance the fragile RACCS ecosystem. The palm oil companies that participated in the PaSos platform jointly identified High Conservation Value Areas (HCVAs) and developed action plans to protect these HCVAs in a cost effective manner. Incentives were developed to support the process towards jurisdictional RSPO certification. By the end of 2020, as a result of the RSPO National Interpretation process, the regional government, as well as the companies involved have shown interest in certifying the entire RACCS under the jurisdictional certification scheme of RSPO. In addition, the national government has shown interest in reviewing and adjusting the Nicaraguan Compulsory Technical Standard of Sustainable Palm Oil (NTON).
We also worked with two companies to develop and implement a smallholder-inclusive business model. This model offers a mechanism through which smallholders receive a better price, while it reduces the chances of potential land conflicts between smallholders and companies, and supports smallholders’ livelihood diversification. In addition, we co-initiated the “Livestock Zero Deforestation” platform through which, together with private sector actors and CSOs, we aim to work towards a “deforestation-free label” for dairy and beef, and promote the diversification of livestock farms with cocoa and agroforestry.

title.narrative: Good Practices - Economic
% change in yield or productivity

comment.narrative: 14 TM FFB/ha Palm oil Company Is the same data reported in PfC MAPA NIC We use a national stadistics as a base line, in the case of producers, we started the capacity building of producers to improve the plantations management (Pest control, Vegetal Nutrition and RSPO Certification), this practices have impacts in FFB productio. In the case of companies only 2 reported 148/5000 The high increases in the performance of companies may be due to the fact that most of the plantations reached the age of a commercial volume and this was compared versus the base line of national avarage.

title.narrative: # of pilots consortia developed to test landscape solutions

comment.narrative: Currently, two opportunities have been identified to another tw: one is the inclusion of small producers in the sustainable production of palm oil sector as a strategy for the development of RACCS, and avoid deforestation as a result of the livestock expansion, with one palm oil company (San Jose). The second pilot opportunity is the joint identification and management of High Conservation Value areas at the landscape level with six palm oil companies (Cukra Development Corporation, San Jose, Palcasa, Olecaribe, Wapi Industrial, Nicavista)

title.narrative: # of pilots consortia developed to test landscape solutions

comment.narrative: The pilot of the Palm OIl Inclusive Business model for the inclusion of small palm producers with the company San Jos������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������������ was affected due to the socio-political situation of the Nicaragua, since the financing was suspended by the bank. However, the company decided to implement the pilot with its own funds and with a smaller scope (10 small producers with 200 hectares)

comment.narrative: Scheduled for 2018. The platform of PASOS doesn't have governance structure yet, the stakeholder are organized under 5 work groups (multi stakeholder platforms, research, best practices in productive systems, restoration of degraded areas, and Pearl Lagun).

title.narrative: Inclusive multistakeholder landscape governance structure implemented
Level of inclusiveness of Governance structure

comment.narrative: The governance structure proposed addresses the inclusion of all actors (small producers and companies from Palm oil, cocoa and livestock sectors, CSO, goverment, and comunieties). This proposal also considers the inclusion of women to participate in decision-making proccess as a mechanisms for the improvement of their livelihoods.

title.narrative: # CSOs that are being trained or supported in decision making and dialogue

comment.narrative: The stakeholders capacity building started, through the integrated landscape management fellowship. The goal is developing leaders with the ability to influence or manage under the landscape approach. The first workshop seeked for the stakeholders to understand the landscape approach and gave some tools to begging to analyse under this approach. As a result of the self evaluation of the workshop, the score average about of the extent to which the understanding of integrated landscape management has improved was 4.35 out of 5 (high score). In 2018 the development of capacities continues, so that the actors can influence and manage at the landscape level.

# + names of MSPs, partnerships and/or dialogues to resolve landscape issues

comment.narrative: 1 MSP PASOS Conformed 1 Zero Deforestation Livestock Platform 1 Technical Committee for the National Interpretation RSPO (Socialization of PyC and new guidelines for monitoring the IN)

title.narrative: # + names of MSPs, partnerships and/or dialogues to resolve landscape issues

comment.narrative: The platform of PASOS doesn't have governance structure yet, the stakeholder are organized under 5 work groups (multi stakeholder platforms, research, best practices in productive systems, restoration of degraded areas, and Pearl Lagun). There is a governance proposal and action plan developed for the platform. The national Interpretation of RSPO dialogue was organized through a technical committee, this process is a mechanism at the landscape level that seeks the integration of different actors to understand their needs and move towards a sustainable production of palm oil, at landscape level. 23 stakeholders are involved in the National Interpretation of RSPO dialogue (5 CSOs, 10 private sector, 8 public sector).

title.narrative: # + kind of stakeholders that participate in MSPs on landscapes

comment.narrative: The stakeholders capacity building started., through the integrated landscape management fellowship. The goal is developing leaders with the ability to influence or manage under the landscape approach. The first workshop seeked for the stakeholders to understand the landscape approach and gave some tools to begging to analyse under this approach. As a result of the self evaluation of the workshop, the score average about of the extent to which the understanding of integrated landscape management has improved was 4.35 out of 5 (high score). In 2018 the development of capacities continues, so that the actors can influence and manage at the landscape level.
